text:
Hey everyone!

I'm a data scientist (cto at a series A fintech startup in Southeast Asia) who is mainly coming from R applied to finance. I'm interested in Julia mainly to solve the two language problem in our data work, and to see if the language can be useful outside of scientific computing like web app backends.

I'm documenting my findings in this Julia package so I can synthesize them later: <https://github.tjpalanca.com/LearningJulia.jl/dev/>

Thanks for the great resources and so far welcoming community!

text: Re web app backends: you probably know this already, but check out <https://github.com/GenieFramework/Genie.jl> if you haven’t already! and <https://discourse.julialang.org/t/stipple-reactive-data-dashboards-with-julia-wip/37291/73>

attachments.title: Stipple: Reactive data dashboards with Julia [WIP]
attachments.text: What is your take on svelte?

text: Thanks <@US8V7JSKB>! Yes Genie.jl looks very promising for the interfaces where we collect data (also comes with ORM) and the Stipple.jl library is a great analogue to Shiny dashboards internally.

elements.text: ! Yes Genie.jl looks very promising for the interfaces where we collect data (also comes with ORM) and the Stipple.jl library is a great analogue to Shiny dashboards internally.
